alert.note: Alert for Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley; Chukchi Sea Coast; Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 14 at 6:29PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...Wind Chill 40 to 55 Below... Wind Chill as cold as 40 to 55 below range through most of the week. Cold temperatures continue in the Chukchi Sea and Kotzebue Sound Regions with low temperatures in the 20s to 30s below, while high temperatures will only reach into the teens and 20s below. Wind will generally be less than 10 mph through the week, except for the area from the Red Dog Dock north along the coast where winds will pick up to 15 to 25 mph Wednesday. Residents should use caution if they are outside and ensure that they are protected from the cold as frostbite can occur with less than 10 minutes of exposure. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
